attributes.action: Abolish plans for extended Sunday trading hours in England
attributes.background: Sunday trading hours are already extensive enough without increasing them and further, removing any quality family time that may be enjoyed by those that work in the retail sector. Productivity and profit will not increase, only time and costs involved will be added to. Say no to extra time!
attributes.additional_details: 500 characters is not enough to lay the foundations of an objection to the extending of retail opening hours. I would however be happy to stand before parliament and offer my thoughts on any proposed increase to Sunday trading hours. Should any owner of a retail outlet in the UK, be opposed to my petition, then I will happily face them and debate my point until the proverbial cows come home! Please be aware, I would encourage substantial evidence to prove a benefit in increased trading hours.

attributes.action: Local councils must adhere to The Care Act; by offering choice of care provider.
attributes.background: In an attempt to reduce cost councils (LA's) are removing the right of choice from those who receive care and support. By appointing one provider forcing people to accept the care provider offered rather than the one better placed to support them.
attributes.additional_details:
Central to the Care Act 2014 is wellbeing. At the heart of the principle of wellbeing is ‘control over day- to-day life, including over care and support and the way it is provided.’

This is because choice and control is fundamental to the core purpose of adult care and support which the Care Act guidance sees as being to ‘help people to achieve the outcomes that matter to them in their life.’ 

Current practice is not recognising the legialation introduced to protect vulnerable people.

attributes.action: Take Portugal's stances and decriminalize all drug possession.
attributes.background: The Portuguese government have decriminalised all illegal drugs. Drug addicts should not be treated like criminals and should be helped, not punished. Portugal has one of the lowest drug overdose rates in Europe whereas the UK has the highest.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Drug_policy_of_Portugal

attributes.action: Grant maintenance loans to full time distance learning students
attributes.background: I'm a student studying at the open university and I have chosen to study full time, this means I don't have time for a job, however I am only eligible for a part time tuition fee loan as I am a distance learning student, this means I only get my tuition fee paid for.
attributes.additional_details: As distance learning students we have to study harder because we don't have as many face to face lectures with out tutor and those of us that choose to do our degree full time are not eligible for a maintenance loan to help support us through our studies like other full time students which then means since we don't have time for a full time job and sometimes a part time job either depending on out degree we have to find other ways to support us financially through our studies.

attributes.action: Stop the double taxation of fuel through Duty and VAT
attributes.background: Fuel is taxed using fuel duty and vat, which I consider to be an unfair double tax

attributes.action: Outlaw Opencast coal mining in the UK due to extreme environmental impacts.
attributes.background: Opencast coal mining in the UK is becoming even more popular. This way of mining has a detrimental impact on the environment and people. Opencast coal mining involves the extraction of coal via surface mining. Ecology of the area become effected, villages become effected by dust and noise.
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.foe.co.uk/green-blog/can-you-imagine-what-its-like-live-next-opencast-coal-mine.
Opencast coal mining involves the extraction of earth and rocks from the surface of a mining area where the earth will be blasted apart to get to thin coal seems within. This effects landscape, people, wildlife, agricultural land, etc. Then, after the coal extraction there is a large risk that the mining area could be abandoned and not regenerated as companies promised before they begun extraction.

attributes.action: Adding lessons about eating disorders to the PSHCE national curriculum
attributes.background: We believe that schools should include eating disorders to the national PHSCE curriculum because many adolescents do not understand the severity of eating disorders. For example some think that only teenage girls get eating disorders and if someone is skinny is means that they are anorexic.

attributes.action: Stop proposed loss of the Cotswolds within Gloucestershire to West Oxfordshire.
attributes.background: It is proposed that Cotswold District Council cease to administer The Cotswolds within Gloucestershire & that West Oxfordshire District Council take over that role. The 190,000 population have not been consulted. An ancient region would be lost to contrived unitary administration.
attributes.additional_details:
The Cotswold Disrtict area within Gloucestershire should not be allowed to pass into the hands of West Oxfordshire. The leader of Gloucestershire County Council has said it will "rip up" the county. Numerous bodies within the County have also expressed their concerns that this proposal would be detrimental, including the Crime Commissioner & the Chief Executive of Gloucestershire Hospitals.
This proposal is a threat to regional stability, pride & history.

attributes.action: Force the BBC to scrap the licence fee in favour of funding from advertisements.
attributes.background: Since the 1940's the BBC have used scare tactics and in some cases, harassment to enforce the issuing of its TV licence fee on members of the general public. We would like for them to stop these tactics and obtain funding through advertisements like all other freeview channels.
attributes.additional_details:
http://goo.gl/Vi8jgg - BBC using bullying tactics.
http://goo.gl/Q8uqAS - BBC loses rights to host Olympic broadcasts.
http://goo.gl/wehWFk - BBC propaganda about licence fee.
http://goo.gl/LTvSIy - Sentencing inequality in courts.
http://goo.gl/vE5fJd - 60% of Brits prefer the ad supported model.

attributes.action: Scrap IPSA & replace with public board that's fully accountable and transparent
attributes.background: IPSA was meant to work in the interest of public funds raised by taxes, it is clear that this is not the case. http://goo.gl/2AgVXM and http://goo.gl/fcdt5t It is time IPSA was replaced with a public board fully transparent and accountable to the public.
attributes.additional_details: Additionally http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/newstopics/mps-expenses/ In these times of austerity when public servants are being told they can have 0-1% rise because there is no money but some MP'S and other members in the House Of Commons seem to think it is fine to claim for beeswax candles for example. Some expenses claims are more than 2 members of the public on minimum wage earn all year.  Why do our political class think this is fine, because they can and do seem to get away with it.

attributes.action: Political neutrality rules should apply to both TV & newspapers during elections
attributes.background: Whilst recognising the need for a pluralistic press the referendum campaign demonstrated media barons attempt to influence voting. We believe this to be wrong and that newspapers should adopt a neutral, balanced and fair position during campaigns as TV news is required to do

attributes.action: Reject any statutory instrument preventing McKenzie Friends charging a fee
attributes.background: In February 2016, the UK Judiciary quietly published a Consultation paper on reforming their approach to McKenzie Friends (MFs) who are (non-Solicitor/Barrister helpers). The Judiciary proposes preventing MFs from charging fees, regulating them, yet no have the right to 'represent' you for Court.
attributes.additional_details: The Presidents Guidance on McKenzie Friends 2010 gives the judges discretion to permit your MF to act for you and manage your case.  It is very rare to get permission. The Employment Tribunals Act 1998 s6 provides that a person may appear in person or else be represented at an employment tribunal by: (a) counsel/ solicitor, (b) a rep of a trade union or an employers’ association, or (c) any other person in whom the party desires to represent him. The same rights should apply in family courts.

attributes.action: Make Education Maintenance Allowance universal for all school pupils over 16
attributes.background: Educational Maintenance Allowance (EMA) is given to pupils who fall into the means tested limits set by government. This provides pupils with £60 biweekly. Universal payments would give all senior pupils a major incentive to fully participate in the education system.

attributes.action: Allow all television broadcasts to use extracts of parliamentary proceedings.
attributes.background: Rupa Huq acting on behalf of constituent Charlie Brooker requested a debate and possible change to the law to allow the use of footage from Parliament in comedy and entertainment shows. This was blocked by Chris Grayling. We request that this be debated and for the law to be changed to allow use.
attributes.additional_details:
The full story: http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2016/03/03/charlie-brooker-cant-take-the-piss-out-of-mps-because-chris-grayling-wont-let-him_n_9372500.html?utm_hp_ref=uk

http://www.independent.co.uk/news/uk/politics/parliament-satire-ban-house-of-commons-charlie-brooker-tories-a6909391.html

attributes.action: Medals awarded to British service Personal to be made in UK not France.
attributes.background:
A French company has been awarded a contract to make 20 British honours including the Distinguished Service Order (DSO), awarded to senior Armed Forces officers for meritorious service during combat. 
Arthur Bertrandbeat beat bids from the likes of the Royal Mint. In a contract worth £1.3 million.

attributes.action: Make a mandatory 6 months ban if caught using mobile phone while driving
attributes.background: We've all seen the results of driving while using a phone and many people are still doing it. If the law was a 6 month ban on the first instance, this would deter people from doing it again. You will loose income without a licence. Get caught again and it's a 12 months ban.
attributes.additional_details: Public should also be allowed to forward dash cam footage to police to help with a conviction. Over 500,000 people a day are still using phones while driving. 1 in 5 accident are results of phone usage. How would you feel if one of those 5 killed a member of your family because they had a phone in their hand? The consequences for this are too lenient to stop people doing it. Skip the points and fines, straight 6 months ban and points should be mandatory.

attributes.action: Create a new bank holiday on 16 June 2016
attributes.background: We want Thursday 16th June to be a new bank holiday to allow people to watch the Euro 2016 England vs Wales and Ukraine vs Northern Ireland football games. This is the first time Wales and Northern Ireland have competed in the Euros and we do not want employees to be deprived of this privilege.
attributes.additional_details: We think this would be a positive movement in order to encourage the friendly and competitive nature of football. The European Championships only occur once every four years and employees will be denied of this privilege due to working circumstances. The England vs Wales game includes two of the UKs countries competing at 2.30pm, meaning employees will not be able to watch this. Additionally, the Northern Ireland vs Ukraine game is on at 5.00pm which further restricts employees.

attributes.action: Add a "none of the above" option to all ballot papers.
attributes.background: Consent is central to the concept of democracy. But consent is only measurable if it is possible to withhold it. This is not possible in current elections as the only options available are abstaining and spoiling the ballot in protest - neither being an accurate measure of voter discontent.
attributes.additional_details:
The above introduction was based on the following page from 38degrees. This page provides more information and context as to the importance of a "none of the above option"

https://you.38degrees.org.uk/petitions/inclusion-of-an-official-none-of-the-above-option-for-all-uk-elections-2

attributes.action: Stop HS2 & fund the NHS & West/East Coast mainlines for the same or less cost!
attributes.background:
The Facts:
NHS budget for 2015-2016 is £116.4 billion
HS2 current official projected (but of course unrealistic) cost is £55.7 billion!* Thats half of the entire NHS budget!
*As of 08/02/2016
attributes.additional_details:
Put simply, would you prefer to save around 15 mins travelling to Birmingham or save our NHS AND improve the existing rail network?

Lets ensure that parliament hear and respond. If  this reaches 100,000 signatures then they must do so. 

Please sign and share on Facebook and all other media.

attributes.action: Create level one "supported apprenticeships" for young people with SEN.
attributes.background: A supported apprenticeship, at the lower minimum wage for apprentices, would encourage employers to "risk" taking on a young person with a learning difficulty and would widen opportunities for college leavers with special educational needs.
attributes.additional_details:
30% of all young people with statements of SEN at 16 are NEET at 18 compared to 13% of their peers.

7% of people with moderate or severe learning difficulties are in work but 65% want to.

L2 qualifications are out of reach for many young people with learning difficulties; 5+ GCSEs at grade A* to C was 22% (cf 69% with no SEND at KS4.

The National Audit Office report estimates that supporting one person with a learning disability into employment could increase that person’s income by 55-95%.

attributes.action: Scrap Vehicle Excise (VED) and replace it  by placing 1p a litre on fuel.
attributes.background:
This proposal would mean that 
a) the people who use the roads the most,    pay the most and the people who don't use the roads much pay the least.
b) it will remove the administrative burden on DVLA and
c) allow law enforcement officers to contract on other areas

attributes.action: Say No to an "Independence Day" Bank Holiday on 23rd June.
attributes.background:
Nigel Farage has called for the 23rd of June to be celebrated as the UK's "Independence Day", and that the date should be a Bank Holiday.

We the undersigned feel that Mr. Farage should not be rewarded in this fashion for his actions in the EU Referendum.
attributes.additional_details:
A Bank Holiday bearing Mr. Farage's name would be giving too much publicity to a man who has misled the electorate on multiple occasions, and who behaved despicably with regard to the "Breaking Point" poster.

This Bank Holiday would also be offensive to the 16.1m voters who voted to remain a part of the European Union, and who would not want be reminded of this fact every year.

attributes.action: Help support me to bring about 'Kieron's Law.'
attributes.background: I want to call on Government for information leaflets to be sent to every household in the UK to show natural parents their rights as described here-  https://www.gov.uk/child-adoption/birth-parents-your-rights. I do-not have a live Case which pertains to child custody decisions being made in Court
attributes.additional_details: Through lack of information rights, i almost died as a consequence. I'm recovering alcoholic of 8 years. I call on Government to add information to include parental rights, data protection rights, children's rights, compliments and complaints links to Children's Services, Cafcass, medical court expert witnesses, Judges, Solicitors, Barnardo's, Surestart and links to human rights. I would request that this information be added where Local Councils provide the printed information already.

attributes.action: We call upon the Secretary of State for Health to define "A Seven Day NHS"
attributes.background: In addition,to state whether it is Minister's intentions to increase the work force by the 20-40% necessary to achieve a "A Seven Day NHS",the size of increase depending on the definition offered. Or to simply shift staff from one time frame to another, thereby degrading the whole service?
attributes.additional_details:
For many months now, various senior government members have trotted out the phrase "A Seven Day NHS" without defining their intentions. Do they mean emergency cover at all times? Do they mean enhancing the current emergency cover by increasing diagnostic and other services out of hours? Or do they mean elective services seven days a week?
Each model implies a very different requirement for staffing, and associated funding. 
We call upon the Minister to set out this Governments plans in detail.

attributes.action: Create a system for doctors to refer patients with two or more cancer symptom.
attributes.background: Mum presented many cancer symptoms over two years each treated individually, and the lump diagnosed as a cyst. She actually had advanced ovarian cancer. If she had been tested on symptoms being first presented she would have had a better chance of survival.
attributes.additional_details:
Professor Graham Neale found 15% misdiagnosed as minor ailments.
Early diagnosis of ovarian cancer has a survival rate of 90% rather than 5% for advanced stages of the disease and 70% compared to 14% in lung cancer. 
Diagnostic routes range between 12 and 38% of cancer cases diagnosed by Doctor referrals between 3% and 58% are diagnosed through hospital admissions. The majority presented at hospital and were far more advanced. One year survival rates were lower for those presenting at hospital.

attributes.action: Let the people of the UK decide if it should be split by Scotland's departure.
attributes.background: Scots had a referendum to decide if Scotland should be independent - and decided against. If they decide to try again there should be a referendum of the whole of the UK instead - the decision is bigger than just what Scotland wants - it is about what the UK wants and the future of our country.

attributes.action: Patrons & trustees of charities are automatically disqualified from being an MP
attributes.background: Many MP's voted in favour of benefit cuts & are also associated with charities for those directly affected proving a LACK OF SUPPORT and a CONFLICT OF INTEREST. To avoid this MP's should resign their position within charities immediately & should NOT be allowed association with charities in any role

attributes.action: Mock vote for 16-17 year olds, on EU referendum
attributes.background: Since the referendum has caused so much distress for many people, I believe there should be a mock vote  for the youth to prove what they want for their future. Young people have had no say in the referendum, and it's time they have their voice heard.

attributes.action: Remove Vat from sun creams of factor 30+ to reduce the incidence  skin cancers.
attributes.background: Expensive Sun tan creams discourage the use of this protection. The incidence of sun related skin cancers is rising as the strength of ultraviolet radiation increases. Act now to protect your and your children's skin from premature aging and the risk of developing potentially fatal skin cancers.
attributes.additional_details: Skin cancer.org

attributes.action: Call for an independent review into political bias within the BBC.
attributes.background: During recent weeks the BBC has been showing bias towards the Conservative party. On numerous occasions the BBC has failed to report fairly on industrial action in the public sector. The latest example is the non reporting of the Conservative party breaking rules on election funding

attributes.action: Reconsider increasing Asylum and immigration court fees
attributes.background: The government intends to increase the fees required to for asylum proceedings increasing the burden on some of the most vulnerable people in the world to meet a shortfall created by inadequately funding the justice system.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.theguardian.com/uk-news/2016/apr/21/asylum-and-immigration-court-fees-set-to-rise-by-over-500

attributes.action: Reverse the decision that four year olds should be tested.
attributes.background:
Children as young as four are being tested during the first days of early years education. 

Teachers and experts alike agree that any testing would provide unreliable results and be detrimental to the settling in period for the children to the new school environment.

attributes.action: Make Continuous Glucose Monitors available on the NHS for Type 1 Diabetics
attributes.background:
CGMs are a considered less invasive than Blood Glucose Meters. They also help users to maintain target blood glucose levels & limit the risk of hypos.

Access to this technology is limited on the NHS. However, they can help to avoid night-time severe hypos, & severe hypos cost the NHS £13m a year.
attributes.additional_details:
CGMs work 24 hours a day and can include alarms to indicate when glucose levels are too high. Research suggests they can help to reduce haemoglobin A1c without increasing the risk of a hypo. 

The initial cost of the hardware for a continuous glucose monitor can vary from around £1,000 to £2,500. In addition to this, running costs are estimated at £40-£60 per 5-7 days. Access to this important technology should not be based upon whether or not the patient is able to afford it.

attributes.action: Create new Animal and Domestic Pet Protection legislation to imprison abusers
attributes.background: Britian is a nation of animal lovers, with an estimated 46% of households having a domestic pet. Unfortunately however, animal cruelty offences continue to occur, with very little in the way of "animal rights" to prevent them, or to punish offenders. Pets mean more than the "property" defined in law
attributes.additional_details:
Recently introduced legislation in the US will allow courts to treat those who abuse animals in the same vein as humans. Numerous physiological research conclude that one of the first steps towards a person being mentally capable of taking another human life often start off abusing and killing animals

At the moment pet homocide can only be treated as 'criminal damage', but with people like the Croydon cat killer freely walking the streets we believe stronger legislation should be introduced.

attributes.action: UK time to ban animals in captivity in zoos and circuses 
attributes.background: Keeping animals in captivity and out of their natural habitat does not benefit them or their species in any way. Large animals like elephants and bears suffer the most as in the wild they roam for many miles daily. Species conservation is best done in the wild, without cages.
attributes.additional_details:
I took my son to a zoo and a circus when he was small & I felt always very sorry for the all the creatures there, I had no knowledge or background in species behavior, however I could still tell these animals were not at their natural best. 
Tigers pacing up and down relentlessly, little intelligent monkeys trying to communicate via the glass and elephants with very little space to live in. 
It all felt wrong then & now I know its wrong, its time to stop.

attributes.action: MPs should have a formal contract setting out their working hours and duties
attributes.background:
MPs receive a public funded salary yet there is a lack of accountability and scrutiny of whether they are carrying out the job satisfactorily.
MPs need a formal contract, setting out their contracted hours, how they are meant to conduct themselves with their constituents as well as at Parliament.

attributes.action: Discuss the threat TTIP, TISA & TTP poses to sovereignty and national safety
attributes.background: TTIP trade-deals are being negotiated, undemocratically, in secret between the EU and the US for corporate interests. The details are undisclosed to the public, yet leaked documents show the agreements will have a deleterious affect on food production, health, pollution liability and national health

attributes.action: Review the justice system,and have a new look at how police can regain  respect
attributes.background: would like to see a new campaign asking people to report crimes no matter how big or small and also outline what the Emergency number 999 is used for and Non Emergency number 101 is used for as there is confusion with the public about this, also to educate children against crime and consequences,
attributes.additional_details: I am co-ordinator of a Facebook page called DN35 CRIMEWATCH, we have over 4100 members within this area, this is a page where all residents can alert others of what is happening in their area, also ask to identify people from CCTV footage, also they report all crime that has happened in the area on there, we then advise accordingly and always promote reporting to police ,  and are against vigilante groups also the page has become a place where we have learned that no-one has faith in the police .

attributes.action: Stop giving Essure (a permanent method of sterilisation) on the NHS
attributes.background: Women in the UK are being given Essure and told that it is a safe, non-surgical, permanent method of sterilisation. They are not being told about the potential side effects.
attributes.additional_details: A recent study published in the BMJ has found that there may be safety issues with Essure. Essure should no longer be used in the NHS.

attributes.action: Label baby food  "suitable from 6 months" as per W.H.O and N.H.S recommendation.
attributes.background:
I work with a team of Health Visitors and give advice to parents about introducing their babies to solid food.
 
Baby food is currently labelled as suitable from 4 months old. This is confusing as NHS guidelines say that infants should be fed milk only, breast or formula, for the first 6 months.
attributes.additional_details:
Research shows that feeding infants exclusively on milk for the first 6 months has a positive effect on our nations health in child and adulthood.

Introducing babies to solid food at 6 months means that normal food can be used and products sold as "baby food" are not needed.  This could save families money.

Clear labelling in line with WHO and NHS guidelines will end confusion and contribute to a healthier population.

attributes.action: Revise section 59 and withdraw the photographer / Car Spotter 48 hour ban/fine
attributes.background: Section 59 is being abused by officers, it is used to threaten high powered supercar owners. The Police Reform Act needs to be revised and officers reminded on how to use there authority. Also car spotters should not face any ban or fine due to the actions of drivers and should be left alone.
attributes.additional_details:
There have been 2 cases of police issuing bans to car spotters and i feel that it is assured, anyone has the right to take a picture. Even so there may be tourists who have flown in and may simply want to take a picture of a luxurious sports car to then face a ban in a well known tourist attraction with a fine. Also in the papers wealthy luxurious have been finding there stay here very troubling and unwelcoming as the police have been stopping them purely for the fact that they can.  

NOCKAM

attributes.action: A Call to Action:  Raising Awareness of Mental Ill-health in Higher Education
attributes.background:
The government and higher education authorities must recognise and prioritise the 'student voice' in promoting mental ill-health in higher education. Josephine NwaAmaka Bardi

Please copy and paste the link below to read more.  

https://imhblog.wordpress.com/
attributes.additional_details:
There is no health without mental health (Department of Health, 2011) just as there may be no academic achievement without mental health.

Please sign the petition in support of this extremely important issue.

It is hoped that our collective signatures will prompt the government to recognise and debate the importance of actively promoting the awareness of mental ill-health in higher education.

Josephine NwaAmaka Bardi
Mental Health Nurse
PhD Student

attributes.action: Abolish vat and council tax
attributes.background: Vat and council got introduced after we joined the European Union. No we are leaving it should be removed from citizens in the uk.

attributes.action: Ask the Government to set out clear proposals for leaving the EU
attributes.background:
We have voted to leave the EU,
BUT we have been given no clear idea of the Government's plans for
1. Our future trading relationships with the rest of the world;
2. Meeting the wishes of dissident parts of the UK.
These plans should be submitted for ratification by the public or Parliament.

attributes.action: Change the colour of all newly issued passports back to blue.
attributes.background: Now that the United Kingdom is leaving the European Union, it would be good to move back to the original 'old blue' colour for the cover, which was replaced by burgundy in the period 1988-93.

attributes.action: Parliament to debate whether cows must be able to graze outside freely.
attributes.background: Countryfile recently showed dairy cows living their whole lives in sheds, 24/7 52 weeks a year. They never feel a breeze or sun on their backs. Fed processed meals they never chew fresh grass. Cruelty to cows is bad for our diets too. We want fair prices for our farmers and freedom for cows. Grass.
attributes.additional_details:
Daily Express on Countryfile programme. 
http://www.express.co.uk/showbiz/tv-radio/657888/Countryfile-viewers-slam-intensive-dairy-farming-Matt-Bake-Ellie-Harrison-Charlotte-Smith

World Animal Protection - Full Fact Milk Pledge
http://www.worldanimalprotection.org.uk/campaigns/factory-farming/take-action-dairy-cows?utm_medium=TWI&utm_source=farming&utm_campaign=#Fullfactmilk&utm_content=PE

attributes.action: Make Voting transparent, publish who has voted , so to eliminate voting fraud
attributes.background:
Its not who voted that counts, Its who counted the votes !!

It is absolutely crazy to me that in democratic societies, the voting process is a secret process. WHY? this opens the door to fraud and voter rigging, a government or party could fudge the numbers and everybody would be non the wiser.
attributes.additional_details:
By making votes transparent on a Gov website, everyone can see their name and everyone can independently verify the facts... not only will this be a fairer society but it means as a people we can start to build some trust back to our government, just looked what happened with the Scottish independence vote, very close to call... but plenty cried foul play .. with a transparent system we all would know... and truth is a very rare commodity these days. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3YKpvTBmdCI

attributes.action: Balance bike lessons on the National Curriculum for all Early Years children.
attributes.background: If you love seeing children cycling, and want every child in the UK to ride a bike before they are six, then please sign this petition and help The Bicycle Society achieve their mission: cycling to become a compulsory part of the National Curriculum for Nursery, Reception and Year One children.
attributes.additional_details:
Balance bikes are light with no pedals or stabilisers. With proven teaching methods, children will learn to balance and pedal competently, confidently and consistently. Highly engaging teaching and enjoyable games pin positive emotions to cycling, moulding our cyclists of the future.

Benefits:

-Increased cycle safety/Bikeability.

-Contribution to sustainable transport.

-Improved long-term health.

-Healthier communities.

-Reduced cost to NHS.

-Sport legacy.

Every child deserves to cycle.

attributes.action: Provide increased educational support to refugee children in Calais.
attributes.background: The vast majority of refugee children have no access to education whilst waiting for refuge, meaning their aspirations are cruelly taken away by the likes of poverty and violence. We must strive to make a difference to the lives of these children, who are innocent victims in a dreadful conflict.
attributes.additional_details: The story of a 13 year old refugee named Sajev, with dreams of attending Oxbridge inspired me to create this petition, I am a 15 year old girl who also has dreams of attending Oxbridge, and Sajev's story opened my eyes to how privileged I am to be able to go to school each day. We can and must make a difference to the lives of these children, who have had their education stolen from them by conflict and so I call upon my country to stand for these children, who are not so different from our own.

attributes.action: Lower the EU referendum voting age to 17.
attributes.background: I am a 17-year-old, A-level politics students, I feel educated enough to make a rational decision in the upcoming referendum. The Scottish referendum allowed 16-year-olds to vote as it directly affects their lives; as the EU referendum affects mine.
